meanings.definition: Lack of clarity or logical connection in thought or speech.
meanings.sent1: The incoherence in his argument made it hard to follow his point.
meanings.sent2: The incoherence of her story left everyone confused.
meanings.sent3: The incoherence in his explanation was like trying to solve a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent4: The incoherence of his words painted a picture of chaos in our minds.
meanings.sent5: The incoherence of the directions led us in circles.

meanings.definition: The state of being disjointed or inconsistent.
meanings.sent1: The incoherence of the plot made the movie hard to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with incoherence, jumping from one topic to another.
meanings.sent3: The incoherence of the schedule left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The incoherence of her actions left us wondering what she was thinking.
meanings.sent5: The incoherence of the plan resulted in chaos and confusion.

meanings.definition: Unable to be understood or interpreted clearly.
meanings.sent1: The incoherence instructions left us lost in the city.
meanings.sent2: Her incoherence response only added to the confusion.
meanings.sent3: The incoherence message on the sign made us chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The incoherence painting left the art critics puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The incoherence explanation only raised more questions.
